intro: Pteroselinum intermedium, commonly known as the Mediterranean parsley, is a herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes other aromatic herbs like carrots and dill. The plant features finely divided, feathery leaves that are often used as a culinary herb due to their mild, parsley-like flavor. It produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. Pteroselinum intermedium is often grown for its ornamental value as well as its edible leaves.
